commit_message:
Add capability to compute.limits object to poll other projects

At present, it is not possible for an admin user to query the limits of
all projects using this SDK.

This patch enables a client with valid admin credentials to pass the
project_id parameter to compute.limits.get to query projects other than
their own.

Example use of this: an admin generating a list of all the quotas and
usages of all projects in the cloud.

Change-Id: I0043697da8abde9950e04f14802e9f752459e7b9

commit_message:
Normalize object resources

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized object, the
current return of the create and retrieve functions were considered;
new fields considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- bytes
- content_type
- hash
- last_modified
- location (new)
- name
- properties (new)

Change-Id: I6e0adad9493a1e7e0914ac9cf0a42963d3e20254
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/34/602234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow returning munch on create and get object

The attribute return_metadata is added to the get_container and
create_container signatures, defaulting to true. When set to false,
get_container will return (munch, body) instead of (metadata, body),
while create_container will return munch instead of metadata.

Story: #2003572
Task: #24866

Change-Id: I0fb10569b236b8f0f231fbe673aa0724de0669c7

commit_message:
Glance v2 allows people to overwrite metadata key

Seems like glance isn't all that strict on setting metadata
and on sending it back out; so to help coerce the metadata that
glance sends back into a type we can use we need to json load
it if it is a string type (vs a dict), especially when a user
has written that key themselves.

Change-Id: Ie52488089c55ab2eaad7530de6365486eddbedb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/58/592658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Modify the 'auth_type' value to correct

The default of 'auth_type' is 'password', if we use OS_TOKEN and
don't set OS_AUTH_TYPE=token, it would return a cryptic message
because it does not expect a token to be use.
The patch modify the 'auth_type' value if we use --os-token,
OS_TOKEN or auth.token.

Change-Id: I9b81b7af89c1240515f025b4bcbceb358bcdb9b5
Task: 33691
Story: 2005877

commit_message:
Add function examples test for clustering

* Add senlin to zuul devstack environment
* Fix clustering examples module parameter error

Change-Id: Ibaeee6011fbc735d2dd9230136219917d3fd7673
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/62/555762/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack.tests.functional import base from examples import connect from examples.clustering import profile as clustering_profile from examples.clustering import profile_type as clustering_profile_type from examples.clustering import policy as clustering_policy from examples.clustering import policy_type as clustering_policy_type from examples.clustering import cluster as clustering_cluster from examples.clustering import node as clustering_node from examples.clustering import receiver as clustering_receiver from examples.clustering import event as clutering_event from examples.clustering import action as clustering_action class TestClustering(base.BaseFunctionalTest): """Test the clustering examples The purpose of these tests is to ensure the examples run without erring out. """ def setUp(self): super(TestClustering, self).setUp() self.conn = connect.create_connection_from_config() def test_clustering_list(self): clustering_profile_type.list_profile_types(self.conn) clustering_profile.list_profiles(self.conn) clustering_policy_type.list_policy_types(self.conn) clustering_policy.list_policies(self.conn) clustering_cluster.list_cluster(self.conn) clustering_node.list_nodes(self.conn) clustering_receiver.list_receivers(self.conn) clutering_event.list_events(self.conn) clustering_action.list_actions(self.conn) def test_clustering_create(self): clustering_profile.create_profile(self.conn) clustering_node.create_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.create_cluster(self.conn) clustering_receiver.create_receiver(self.conn) clustering_policy.create_policy(self.conn) def test_clustering_delete(self): clustering_profile.delete_profile(self.conn) clustering_node.delete_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.delete_cluster(self.conn) clustering_receiver.delete_receiver(self.conn) clustering_policy.delete_policy(self.conn) def test_clustering_update(self): clustering_profile.update_profile(self.conn) clustering_node.update_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.update_cluster(self.conn) clustering_receiver.update_receiver(self.conn) clustering_policy.delete_policy(self.conn) def test_clustering_find(self): clustering_profile.find_profile(self.conn) clustering_node.find_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.find_cluster(self.conn) clustering_receiver.find_receiver(self.conn) clustering_policy.find_policy(self.conn) def test_clustering_check(self): clustering_node.check_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.check_cluster(self.conn) def test_clustering_recover(self): clustering_node.recover_node(self.conn) clustering_cluster.recover_cluster(self.conn) def test_clustering_policy(self): clustering_cluster.cluster_attach_policy(self.conn) clustering_cluster.cluster_detach_policy(self.conn) def test_clustering_node(self): clustering_cluster.cluster_add_nodes(self.conn) clustering_cluster.cluster_del_nodes(self.conn)

added_lines: from openstack import utils def add_user(self, session, user): """Add a user to the group""" url = utils.urljoin(self.base_path, self.id, 'users', user.id) resp = session.put(url,) if resp.status_code == 204: return True return False def remove_user(self, session, user): """Remove a user from the group""" url = utils.urljoin(self.base_path, self.id, 'users', user.id) resp = session.delete(url,) if resp.status_code == 204: return True return False

commit_message:
Add an error message when router add subnet

When router add subnet that it's cide overlaps with existing
associated subnet, the openstack CLI didn't print any error.
The patch exposes the error message about subnet conflict.

Change-Id: I25f1bf85564fbc0d9aa4ac82180a789683902d6a
Task: 13849
Story: 1747525

commit_message:
Fix 'block_store' aliases define error

This patch fix volume aliases error, the service type use
'block-storage', but aliases define use 'block_storage'.
So, Can't use 'block_store' finish list volumes.

Change-Id: I4741d953ad151b945617027946f53f2f526a2e93
Closes-Bug: #1757032

commit_message:
Strip the version prefix from the next link for pagination

keystoneauth1 appends the version prefix to the url causing the
pagination url to be incorrect when using the url prefix from
next link. Thus we are stripping the version prefix from the
next link for pagination to work correctly

Change-Id: Iad8e69d20783cfe59c3e86bd6980da7dee802869
Closes-Bug: 1748534
(cherry picked from commit 76b941dbb3f2ab700af9573f1d31b974f5fa851d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/75/560975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if next_link and next_link.startswith('/v'): next_link = next_link[next_link.find('/', 1) + 1:]

commit_message:
Fix --limit param in cluster objects

When we excute list command of cluster objects with param
--limit 1, senlinclient return all records. But actually, we only
need the first record.

Change-Id: Icdb9b4017547729e2fa1dfebc8f8f00ce8103331
Closes-Bug: #1752014

commit_message:
Fix api request miss microversions

This patch fix api request, add default_microversion parameter
configure microversions, the default_microversion value is 'None',
if the service set api version, the default_microversion value
is api_version, if the api request miss microversions,
the server can't finish microversion controller.

Change-Id: Id8a1df57ba0b04fdba9817e62c9149bc72f2cb09
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/31/555231/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if service_type and service.api_version: kwargs['api_request'] = service.api_version

commit_message:
Remove support for arbitrary attributes from CloudRegion

Early in os-client-config's life we added a magical __getattr__
that would let you access settings from the config dict as arbitrary
object access. That worked fine-ish for a short while before we started
growing a real API on that object.

However, now it's pretty awful, because if someone tries to call a
method that doesn't exist, they get an error about NoneType not having
an attribute - because the magical getattr is returning None for their
object lookup and then python tries to call that.

Before we get too many people migrated from os-client-config to
openstack.config, remove the magic.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540481
Change-Id: I63463824b7a9a2b47c92d6b9aa4c0f47f5b88766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/06/540406/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove deprecated wait_for methods from Proxy

The wait_for methods on the Proxy base class are deprecated for removal.
With the proxy2/proxy switch done, it seems like a good time to go ahead
and remove them.

Change-Id: I414e68a305856e9ed1d8f13270d37e0398bdc350

The cinder-mypy job is failing because library stubs aren't installed
for requests [0].  Modify the mypywrap.sh to accept options specified
in an environment variable named OS_MYPY_OPTS to the mypy invocation,

commit_message:
Add installation of mypy stubs packages

The cinder-mypy job is failing because library stubs aren't installed
for requests [0].  Modify the mypywrap.sh to accept options specified
in an environment variable named OS_MYPY_OPTS to the mypy invocation,
and set this var in tox.ini.

The value is "--install-types --non-interactive" which is suitable for
CI purposes, and seems to make sense for local tox use as well [1].
The downside is it basically runs mypy twice, once to determine
whether there are any library stubs missing and then install them, and
againto do the actual check.  If we don't want this setting in
tox.ini, we can move it to .zuul.yaml for the cinder-mypy job run.

Also, update the version of mypy in test-requirements to a version
that supports the above options.

And, run mypy in its own env (instead of reusing pep8) so that the
tox logs are preserved during CI runs.

[0] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b66ee6c21e594940941585b0e9e5082a
[1] https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/running_mypy.html#library-stubs-not-installed

Change-Id: Id69cb519ee7300b33ff087de4e7d46cdad67d162
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/06/800306/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setenv = OS_MYPY_OPTS=--install-types --non-interactive

commit_message:
Repropose vGPU support spec

Change-Id: I6d0772be947cb813790224f244f00c046110760c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/52/780452/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================ libvirt supports composing cyborg owned vGPU into domain XML ============================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cyborg-vgpu-support This blueprint proposes to enable vGPU accelerator in nova and cyborg interaction. Problem description =================== In order to allow operators to use cyborg to manage the lifecycle of vGPU, cyborg needs to discover the vGPUs, reports them to placement, and instruct nova to allocate a specific vgpu mdev to the instance. Cyborg managed vGPUs will not replace nova's native vGPU capabilities [1]_ and will provide an alternative management mechanism in parallel to the existing nova feature. In the current cyborg-nova interaction [2]_, there is still a small gap in allocating a cyborg owned vGPU to an instance. This spec proposes to support composing cyborg owned vGPU into domain XML in nova libvirt driver. For more information about cyborg side lifecycle management (discover, data modeling etc.) of vGPU please refer to [3]_. Use Cases --------- As an operator, I want to use Cyborg to manage the lifecycle of vGPUs. Proposed change =============== 1. Define the data model in arq to track a cyborg owned vGPU. This data model should provide attach_handle_type to distinguish from a PCI device accelerator, and attach_handle_uuid as the mdev UUID which is used to create a mdev device in the /sys/class/mdev_bus/..., as well as the asked vgpu type of this device. The format will be like: :: { 'attach_handle_type': 'MDEV', 'attach_handle_uuid': '91ac1606-427e-44bb-8233-f4ff4bf3d241', } 2. Nova virt driver merge the mdev info from arq into the XML of an instance. This will need to get mdevs form arq list and pass it to generate guest xml in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py [4]_. Please be aware that the following is just the pseudocode to show the whole function and process. :: # Get mdevs accelerators from ARQ list. mdev_arq_list = [arq for arq in acc_info if arq['attach_handle_type'] == 'MDEV'] mdevs.append(mdevs_accel) xml = self._get_guest_xml(context, instance, network_info, block_disk_info, image_meta, block_device_info=block_device_info, mdevs=mdevs) mdev_arq_list = [arq for arq in acc_info if arq['attach_handle_type'] == 'MDEV'] self._guest_add_accel_mdev_devices(guest, mdev_arq_list) def _guest_add_accel_mdev_devices(self, guest, acc_info): """Adding mdev accelerators from ARQ list. """ for arq in acc_info: self._guest_add_mdevs(guest, arq['attach_handle_uuid']) 3. Cyborg creates mdev device in the sys path In theory, if nova and cyborg both can support vGPU management, nova or cyborg should support create mdev in its own respective. Therefore, in the cyborg lifecycle management of vGPU, cyborg should creates mdev beforehead, nova virt driver uses it as an existed resousrce. * spawn instance interaction(arq interaction part): - nova-conductor requests cyborg to create and bind arq: + cyborg-api rpc.call the cyborg-agent to create a new mdev + cyborg-agent sucessfully created mdev and returns result + cyborg start bind arq + cyborg arq successfully bound and notify nova that ARQ bindings are resolved for a given instance - nova-compute receives bound notification and GET resolved arq - nova-compute calls virt driver to spawn an instance * reboot instance interaction: when nova-compute calls cyborg GET arq API, cyborg does the db lookup and returns the expected arq. * host reboot: cyborg-owned vGPU will be missing from the sys path after host reboot. The cyborg agent should create the mdevs for all bound arqs on start up. Ideally it would set the binding state to "provisioning" on start up also. And we would have anohter state "unknown" that cyborg-api would report if the cyborg agent misses its heart beat. So on start up, when nova compute tries to get accel_info and reboot all the instances, it would see 1 of 3 states, "bound" if the cyborg agent started first and already completed bininding, "unknown" if the cyborg agent has not heartbeat to the cyborg conductor yet, and "provisioning" if the agent is in the process of creating the mdev. Cyborg will send the same binding complete event notification when it change the status form "provisioning" to "bound" as it does during normal arq binding. 4. Avoid conflicts when cyborg vGPU management co-exists with nova vGPU management. * Use owner (nova, cyborg) trait in Placement when inventory is reported. - This will need to add a new namespace in os-traits: OWNER_*. Then nova/cyborg report owner trait OWNER_NOVA/OWNER_CYBORG as one of the trait when inventory is reported. + In the cyborg driver, it will report two traits for vGPU accelerator using the format below. For more details, pls refer to the driver spec [3]_. :: trait1: OWNER_CYBORG. trait2: CUSTOM_<VENDOR_NAME>_<PRODUCT_ID>_<Virtual_GPU_Type>. + In the nova side, it will need to report a new trait **OWNER_NOVA** for vGPU resources during inventory report. - When the end user makes a vGPU request, for a nova owned vGPU request, one can specify ``resources##:VGPU=1`` in flavor. For a cyborg owned vGPU, one need specify in pre-defined device profile, then add it to flavor. * In libvirt driver, use a mdev_tag to identify which vGPU is the current operation request(eg. spawn, reboot) going to land. If it is cyborg vGPU, tag will be 'ACCELERATOR', otherwise it is 'COMPUTE'. - This will need to add a new fuction _get_mdev_tag to identify this according to the given accel_info, and return a tag mdev_tag:'COMPUTE' or 'ACCELERATOR' to indicate this. :: def _get_mdev_tag(self, accel_info): """Identify which vGPU is the current request going to land. parameter: accel_info return: mdev_tag('COMPUTE' or 'ACCELERATOR') """ if not accel_info: tag = 'COMPUTE' else: # here is just to show the logic specification if any arq in accel_info contains {arq['attach_handle_type'] == 'MDEV', arq['attach_handle_uuid'] and arq['attach_handle_info']['asked_type']}: tag = 'ACCELERATOR' else: tag = 'COMPUTE' return tag - And accordingly, we will also need new change in mdev_tag's consumer side, the nova operations side, such as hard_reboot and spawn. 5. Here we take the "boot a VM" scenario as an example. Assuming that Cyborg has reported the vGPU resources and related traits correctly. The workflow is proposed as the following:: +--------+ +-------+ +------------+ +--------+ | admin | | nova | | placement | | cyborg | +---+----+ +--+----+ +-----+------+ +----+---+ | | | | | create device profile | | +--------------+----------------------------------->+ | | | +-----------+ | | | | end user | | | | +----+------+ | | | | | | | | create vm with dp | | +--------------> get device profile | +----------------+------------------>+ | | | | scheduling | | +<-------------->+ | | | | | bind device | | +----------------------------------->+ | | +--+ | | | |create mdev | | return mdev <--+ +<-----------------------------------+ | | | +--+ | | | |insert xml | | +<-+ | | | | | | | | Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployer should make sure the device in one pci address is not configured in both Nova and Cyborg. If it is configured in both Cyborg and Nova should be able to raise this as an conflict exception. If the deployer configure same device in both Cyborg and Nova, they may report same data to Placement at the same time, we can raise conflict exception at Placement side, and return to Cyborg or Nova, and warn the deployer about the conflict device. Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- For those who want to upgrade from nova-owned vGPU to cyborg-owned vGPU, one can resize directly from a flavor with a nova managed gpu (resouces:vgpu=1 in the flavor) to a flavor with a cyborg managed vgpu (accel:device-profile=cyborg-vgpu-device-profile-name). Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com> Other contributors: yumeng-bao Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com> Work Items ---------- * Schedule vGPU resources by device profile * Create vGPU mdev when spawn guest * Unit test and function test to be added Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * New unit test should be added Documentation Impact ==================== * Document need to be changed to describe this feature References ========== .. [1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/ussuri/admin/virtual-gpu.html .. [2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/implemented/nova-cyborg-interaction.html .. [3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758925/ .. [4] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L6139 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Xena - Reproposed

commit_message:
Support fuzzy querying instance by tag

This spec proposes an method for fuzzy querying instance by tag.

Change-Id: I9b9a04e6c9b70a91ca269be49c6cf40c00d98c39
blueprint: support-fuzzy-querying-instances-by-tag
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/768853/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================= Support fuzzy querying instances by tag ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-fuzzy-querying-instances-by-tag The blueprint proposes filtering instances based on tags and supporting fuzzy searching of instances tags. Problem description =================== Currently, only supportting for accurate querying instances by the instance's tag. It can't fuzzy query instance by tag, this is not frinendly for the enduser. Use Cases --------- As a user, we want to get the instances by the partial character of the tag for the instance. Proposed change =============== Add a new microversion to the ``list servers`` and ``list servers detailed`` APIs. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Add a new microversion to the ``list servers`` and ``list servers detailed`` APIs. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Qiu Fossen Other contributors: Brin Zhang Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: Liaison Needed Work Items ---------- * "models.Tag.tag == first_tag" is changed to * "models.Tag.tag.like(first_tag)". * Add unit and functional tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add related unit test for negative scenarios. * Add related functional test (API samples). Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ussuri - Introduced

commit_message:
Cache AgentClient on Task, not globally

In order to avoid potential cache coherency issues
when using a globally cached AgentClient, e.g. with
TSL certificates from the IPA, cache the AgentClient
on a per task basis.

Co-Authored-By: Arne Wiebalck <arne.wiebalck@cern.ch>

Conflicts:
	ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/ansible/deploy.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/iscsi_deploy.py
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent.py

Story: #2009004
Task: #42678

Change-Id: I0c458c8d9ae673181beb6d85c2ee68235ccef239
(cherry picked from commit fcb6a1096f48336f19a5e8aa80445f57d4480c08)

commit_message:
Remove neutron-fwaas for >= V

Also adds config option enable-fwaas which defaults to
True to allow disabling fwaas for releases earlier than
Victoria.

Closes-Bug: 1934129

commit_message:
Revert "Remove convert_data function"

This reverts commit 2f3b09d41ef8feaaf6438693551ea8aaf3a83892.

Reason for revert: This patched caused https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1936465

Reverting until we can investigate better to free up the gate.

commit_message:
Remove convert_data function

This patch removes the convert_data function which has been introduced
with the first one and deprecated Command Line Interface. The
--validation and --group arguments were sending comma-separated strings
instead of list. The new Command Line Interface is now enforcing this by
using its own CommaList Parser Action and only accepting List of groups
or validation names.

This function is now useless and can be removed safely. Tests and usages
have been modified accordingly.

Change-Id: Ief9459e914ea73fbd59a85c07a55c26078e0126a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Don't reverse rules order before applying
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-01 12:28:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/2fff6ec313e64f4945a87af0a246ac714f9ffe41', 'message': 'Don't reverse rules order before applying

When the rules are sorted by name and then reversed, the "999 drop all"
rule gets applied first. On slow connections where ansible may need to
reconnect over SSH while the firewall rules are being applied, the
connection could be denied if the allow rule for SSH is not yet added.
The deployment will then hang and fail.

commit_message:
Don't reverse rules order before applying

When the rules are sorted by name, reversed, and then inserted, the "999
drop all" rule gets applied first. On slow connections where ansible may
need to reconnect over SSH while the firewall rules are being applied,
the connection could be denied if the allow rule for SSH is not yet
added.  The deployment will then hang and fail.

Additionally, if the task fails before all firewall rules are added, the
user wouldn't be able to connect over SSH if that rule is not yet added.

By not using "reverse", and appending the rules instead of inserting,
the "999 drop all" rule will be added last.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If0fae5dfbde6271a32eb9750f06044f402b11215

commit_message:
Fix TypeError when formatting BGP IP address.

floating_ip_address may be a netaddr.IPAddress, and using '+'
to append the /32 suffix raises a TypeError. Explicitly convert to
string before appending the suffix.

Additionally, introduce a unit test case for floatingip_update_callback
to test that the error does not re-appear.

Closes-Bug: #1924237
Signed-off-by: Aggelos Kolaitis <akolaitis@admin.grnet.gr>
Change-Id: I98d266fb986649f1d14969c968baa2f93b469f73
(cherry picked from commit 43f50d5d9b5c8859354014d1c21ed94ad19560d6)

commit_message:
Move tag mixin into the common

As a continuation of a further generalization of methods add a common
module and move tag there.

commit_message:
Add share resource to shared file system

Introduce Shares class with basic methods
including list, create, delete, get and update to
shared file system storage service.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/ashrod98-openstacksdk-manila-support/us/11?kanban-status=2360120

Change-Id: Ia7d7c88eb55307296336e2f04a00e92bdca6f8ae

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack.tests.functional.shared_file_system import base class ShareTest(base.BaseSharedFileSystemTest): def test_share_list_create_get_update(self): #: Create and assert share myshare = self.create_share(name='random', size=2, share_protocol='NFS') self.assertEqual(2, myshare.size) self.assertEqual('random', myshare.name) self.assertEqual('NFS', myshare.share_protocol) self.assertIs(False, myshare.is_public) #: Test list shares shs = self.conn.shared_file_system.shares() for sh in shs: for attribute in ('id', 'name', 'availability_zone', 'created_at', 'status', 'description', 'project_id', 'snapshot_id', 'share_network_id', 'share_protocol', 'share_type', 'task_state', 'share_type_name', 'access_rules_status', 'user_id', 'share_group_id', 'source_share_group_snapshot_member_id', 'progress', 'share_server_id', 'host', 'replication_type'): self.assertTrue(hasattr(sh, attribute)) value = getattr(sh, attribute) if value is not None: self.assertIsInstance(value, str) for attribute in ('is_public', 'is_replicated', 'is_snapshot_supported', 'is_creating_new_share_from_snapshot_supported', 'is_reverting_to_snapshot_supported', 'is_mounting_snapshot_supported'): self.assertTrue(hasattr(sh, attribute)) self.assertIsInstance(getattr(sh, attribute), bool) for attribute in ('metadata', ): self.assertTrue(hasattr(sh, attribute)) self.assertIsInstance(getattr(sh, attribute), dict) for attribute in ('size', ): self.assertTrue(hasattr(sh, attribute)) self.assertIsInstance(getattr(sh, attribute), int) #: Get and assert share get_share = self.conn.share.get_share(myshare.id) self.assertEqual(myshare.size, get_share.size) self.assertEqual(myshare.name, get_share.name) self.assertEqual(myshare.share_protocol, get_share.share_protocol) self.assertIs(myshare.is_public, get_share.is_public) #: Update and assert share new_desc = "testing" new_name = "update" update_share = self.conn.share.update_share( myshare.id, name=new_name, description=new_desc) self.assertEqual(new_name, update_share.name) self.assertEqual(new_desc, update_share.description)

subject: [ironic] Minimize window for a resource provider to be lost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-07 14:28:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/minimize-bug-1841481-race-window-f76912d4985770ad.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0c36bd28ebd05ec0b1dbae950a24a2ecf339be00', 'message': '[ironic] Minimize window for a resource provider to be lost

This patch is based upon a downstream patch which came up in discussion
amongst the ironic community when some operators began discussing a case
where resource providers had disappeared from a running deployment with
several thousand baremetal nodes.

Discussion amongst operators and developers ensued and we were able
to determine that this was still an issue in the current upstream code
and that time difference between collecting data and then reconciling
the records was a source of the issue. Per Arun, they have been running
this change downstream and had not seen any reoccurances of the issue
since the patch was applied.

This patch was originally authored by Arun S A G, and below is his
original commit mesage.

An instance could be launched and scheduled to a compute node between
get_uuids_by_host() call and _get_node_list() call. If that happens
the ironic node.instance_uuid may not be None but the instance_uuid
will be missing from the instance list returned by get_uuids_by_host()
method. This is possible because _get_node_list() takes several minutes to return
in large baremetal clusters and a lot can happen in that time.

This causes the compute node to be orphaned and associated resource
provider to be deleted from placement. Once the resource provider is
deleted it is never created again until the service restarts. Since
resource provider is deleted subsequent boots/rebuilds to the same
host will fail.

This behaviour is visibile in VMbooter nodes because it constantly
launches and deletes instances there by increasing the likelihood
of this race condition happening in large ironic clusters.

To reduce the chance of this race condition we call _get_node_list()
first followed by get_uuids_by_host() method.

Change-Id: I55bde8dd33154e17bbdb3c4b0e7a83a20e8487e8
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <saga@yahoo-inc.com>
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit f84d5917c6fb045f03645d9f80eafbc6e5f94bdd)
'}]
commit_message:
[ironic] Minimize window for a resource provider to be lost

This patch is based upon a downstream patch which came up in discussion
amongst the ironic community when some operators began discussing a case
where resource providers had disappeared from a running deployment with
several thousand baremetal nodes.

Discussion amongst operators and developers ensued and we were able
to determine that this was still an issue in the current upstream code
and that time difference between collecting data and then reconciling
the records was a source of the issue. Per Arun, they have been running
this change downstream and had not seen any reoccurances of the issue
since the patch was applied.

This patch was originally authored by Arun S A G, and below is his
original commit mesage.

An instance could be launched and scheduled to a compute node between
get_uuids_by_host() call and _get_node_list() call. If that happens
the ironic node.instance_uuid may not be None but the instance_uuid
will be missing from the instance list returned by get_uuids_by_host()
method. This is possible because _get_node_list() takes several minutes to return
in large baremetal clusters and a lot can happen in that time.

This causes the compute node to be orphaned and associated resource
provider to be deleted from placement. Once the resource provider is
deleted it is never created again until the service restarts. Since
resource provider is deleted subsequent boots/rebuilds to the same
host will fail.

This behaviour is visibile in VMbooter nodes because it constantly
launches and deletes instances there by increasing the likelihood
of this race condition happening in large ironic clusters.

To reduce the chance of this race condition we call _get_node_list()
first followed by get_uuids_by_host() method.

Change-Id: I55bde8dd33154e17bbdb3c4b0e7a83a20e8487e8
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <saga@yahoo-inc.com>
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit f84d5917c6fb045f03645d9f80eafbc6e5f94bdd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/799772/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Minimizes a race condition window when using the ``ironic`` virt driver where the data generated for the Resource Tracker may attempt to compare potentially stale instance information with the latest known baremetal node information. While this doesn't completely prevent nor resolve the underlying race condition identified in `bug 1841481 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1841481>`_, this change allows Nova to have the latest state information, as opposed to state information which may be out of date due to the time which it may take to retrieve the status from Ironic. This issue was most observable on baremetal clusters with several thousand physical nodes.

revisions:

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib7611b257e17756c4737907215e63ffef371d2ce

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie21c495ee3ed00e5a9406de64d15f2a4245f9a81

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If3ee090783e397b1f6506eb76c28db41f7d65bc7

commit_message:
Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
(cherry picked from commit d5b8ced547f5bf163b7ef76ef82a687af61434f9)

commit_message:
Removing import conditional for 'collections.abc'

The conditional is no longer useful, as the relevant subpackage
is part of 'collections' since python 3.3 and recent tripleo
releases (since Ussuri) use python > 3.6.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I353d04d0322d06e8072edda09978cefde3c36168

commit_message:
Sort jobs in molecule.yaml file when adding new role

This patch adds a mechanism to keep the job names in
zuul.d/molecule.yaml sorted. Therefore, the to_nice_yaml filter is not
indenting lists correctly, due to [1][2].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia8f787631c55fabb3a097919971d17b93711d4b7
(cherry picked from commit ae59abe62c65aaa7286090e2d1b98508d6c7ff6f)
(cherry picked from commit cc29577f73da1c6227461731f04d37c244b29a0e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/23/799623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Managed via ./role-addition.yml, do not edit manually without testing that # new role addition does not reformat it. } {% set project = items.pop(0) %} {% set sorted_jobs = items | sort(attribute='job.name') %} {% set _ = sorted_jobs.insert(0, project) %} {{ sorted_jobs | to_nice_yaml(indent=2, width=1337) }}

commit_message:
Add zuul.d/molecule.yaml file back in the yamllint ignore list

The validation_init role auto generates the molecule.yaml file when
adding a new role. But, due to [1][2], the to_nice_yaml filter is not
correctly indenting lists and will break the indentation every time a
new validation will be created.

This patch adds this file to the yamllint ignore list and provides a new
molecule.yaml sorted by job names as the validation_init role will
generate in a follow up patch.

Moreover, this patch enables the oslo_config_validator molecule job in
the check/gate as it was not added in the initial patch[3].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/789698

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iac63dc6f161a0e885110a246b68001522a6f62e3
(cherry picked from commit 41dcda85921b4a79a46eaccbe28f0fffd516e3cf)
(cherry picked from commit f798c56ba56c1fbda7f7c517044155d80e913ec2)

into path values with creating the appropriate files.

added_lines: # [*ssl_cert_dir*] # (Optional) Path to directory where SSL certificate files should be created. # Defaults to '/etc/pki/tls/certs/' # $ssl_cert_dir = '/etc/pki/tls/certs/', file { $ssl_cert_dir: ensure => directory, mode => '0700' } $prep_ssl_profiles = qdr_ssl_certificate($ssl_profiles, $ssl_cert_dir) $final_ssl_profiles = $prep_ssl_profiles.reduce( [] ) |$memo, $prf| { if has_key($prf, 'caCertFileContent') { file { $prf['caCertFile']: ensure => exists, content => $prf['caCertFileContent'], mode => '0600', require => File[$ssl_cert_dir] } $memo << delete($prf, 'caCertFileContent') } else { $memo << $prf } } ssl_profiles => $final_ssl_profiles,

commit_message:
Neutron: Use the pids subsystem to look up container id

Currently we rely on cgroup name to detect id of sidecar containers but
the name is not managed by podman and it is not guaranteed that it is
consistent with container id.
This changes switches the base record to the pid subsystem which is
actively managed by podman and more likely to be consistent with
container ids.

Closes-Bug: #1933918
Change-Id: Id57f86e62409e257f5619dc8b360cee3f922c805
(cherry picked from commit b1e992a739057d0b3b72dedeb9e6c47a14f47829)
(cherry picked from commit 8c2862d2307b5be069db4ec4c8d90bc3b31ffbb6)

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I28abab34878d3c62a88be8894107f994d02c1c4f

commit_message:
nova-common: add memcached config keys for keystonemiddleware

Modern versions of OpenStack (confirmed under Rocky and Victoria)
have two separate keys for specifying memcached servers to use - one
for Nova itself (which the cookbook already handled) and one for the
Keystone middleware (which it did not). As a result, with only the former
set Nova keeps on complaining in the logs (at least under Rocky) about
still using in-process token cache.

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <marek.szuba@cern.ch>
Change-Id: I7930048a55a26e66c1dd041245ae5b23794eada1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-compute refs/changes/67/800667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # keystonemiddleware needs its own key for this conf['keystone_authtoken']['memcached_servers'] = memcache_servers

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (currently ussuri) are removed.

Change-Id: I2dc146e29c8adef44c1fedce5419e48433c08c33

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2020-07-14 00:51:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-compute/commit/d930febc2f4ed6af2146ccb9b5b1718eb4a10f79', 'message': "Added allocation-ratio config opts

From Liberty onwards nova supports setting allocation ratios in the
hypervisor config (nova-compute level).
Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the nova-scheduler level.
The current default values for the equivlient config opts in the
nova-cloud-controller charm are:

cpu-allocation-ratio: 16
ram-allocation-ratio: 0.98
disk-allocation-ratio: 1.0

These values are replicated in the default values of the charm's config options.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata the ability to have compute
resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing candidates to the
FilterScheduler
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html)

Pike removed CoreFilter, RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.
From this point forward valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are:
- via a call to the placement API:
(https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories)
- via config values to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio)

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker.
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html)
As such the precedence of resource ratio values are:
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio < placement API call < xxx_allocation_ratio

That is if xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will be the only value considered,
otherwise the value will fall back to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may
be overridden.

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223

commit_message:
Added allocation-ratio config opts

Nova supports setting allocation ratios at the nova-compute level from
Liberty onwards. Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the
nova-scheduler level.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata introduced the ability to
have compute resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing
candidates to the FilterScheduler [0]. Pike removed CoreFilter,
RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.

From Pike onwards valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are via:
- A call to the Placement API [1].
- Config values to supplied to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio).

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker [2].

Currently, the precedence of resource ratio values are:
xxx_allocation_ratio > Placement API call > initial_xxx_allocation_ratio

That is a (compute) resource provider's allocation ratios will default
to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may be overridden at run time by a
call to the Placement API. If xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will
override all configurations for that provider.

When not otherwise configured, we set initial_xxx_allocation_ratio to
the values provided by ncc to maintain backwards compatibility. Where
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio is not available we set
xxx_allocation_ratio.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-compute refs/changes/88/717888/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: initial-cpu-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 16.0 description: | The initial value of per physical core -> virtual core ratio to use in the Nova scheduler; this may be overriden at runtime by the placement API. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes at the expense of instance performance. initial-ram-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 0.98 description: | The initial value of physical ram -> virtual ram ratio to use in the Nova scheduler; this may be overriden at runtime by the placement API. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes at the potential expense of instance performance. . NOTE: When in a hyper-converged architecture, make sure to make enough room for infrastructure services running on your compute hosts by adjusting this value. initial-disk-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 1.0 description: | The initial value of this disk allocation ratio. Increase the amount of disk space that nova can overcommit to guests. This may be overriden at runtime by the placement API. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes with an increased risk of hypervisor storage becoming full. cpu-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 16.0 description: | The per physical core -> virtual core ratio to use in the Nova scheduler. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes at the expense of instance performance. ram-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 0.98 description: | The physical ram -> virtual ram ratio to use in the Nova scheduler. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes at the potential expense of instance performance. . NOTE: When in a hyper-converged architecture, make sure to make enough room for infrastructure services running on your compute hosts by adjusting this value. disk-allocation-ratio: type: float default: 1.0 description: | Increase the amount of disk space that nova can overcommit to guests. . Increasing this value will increase instance density on compute nodes with an increased risk of hypervisor storage becoming full.

commit_message:
Configure CPU|RAM|Dask allocation per compute

Starting with the Ocata release, the aggregate-based overcommit
ratios are no longer honored by the placement service for scheduling
purposes. Instead, the allocation ratios should be set per compute
node, which will update placement information used for scheduling.

One option is to propagate the allocation-ratio settings from the
nova-cloud-controller application to the related nova-compute services.
Another option, which provides a bit more flexibility, is to specify it
at the nova-compute level. Adding options to the nova-compute
application falls more in-line with upstream recommendations to set this
at the compute service and will be more clear to users.

As such, this change adds the {cpu,ram,disk}-allocation config options
to the local nova-compute charm. A subsequent change will deprecate the
configuration settings on the nova-cloud-controller application.

Closes-Bug: #1822268
Change-Id: I99cf632866b2b853755c74f0ee73263f9c3f6c38

commit_message:
Fix add ping6 security-rule protocol should icmpv6 directly

From original design,icmp can using ipv4 and ipv6 depend on
ethertype value.but neuitron support icmpv6 protocol now,so when
we create ping6 security-rule,we should using icmpv6 protocol

Change-Id: Icb8d090c3f26c2dec09337191d63b00c51943619
Closes-Bug: #1533025

commit_message:
Identity V3 auth response validation

Tempest wasn't validating that the identity response matched what
is expected according to the API spec.

The schema here is based on what's in keystone's unit tests:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/fe830ffe61912bd6e3d06c1b1eb82ca23f9314eb/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py#L201

exceptions:
- password_expires_at is not required in tempest because it tests
  older versions of keystone and this is new for O.
- pre-Mitaka versions of keystone erroneously included 'extras' in
  the token response. It's always an empty dict.

Change-Id: I6b70fb88f6292a88e94124ea35bd3738261583e0

commit_message:
Adds tempest test for nova volume update

Adds coverage for the nova volume update (aka swap volume)
functionality. This behavior requires admin priveledges to
run.

Change-Id: I66028490958296dde4abc43dc6afab7a4c2f7837

added_lines: def _create_and_attach(self, detach_vol_on_cleanup=True): if detach_vol_on_cleanup: self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], self.volume['id']) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_volume_update(self): # Create Server, Volume and attach that Volume to Server self._create_and_attach(detach_vol_on_cleanup=False) # Get Volume attachment of the server body = self.servers_client.show_volume_attachment( self.server['id'], self.attachment['id']) old_volume_id = body['volumeAttachment']['volumeId'] # Create a volume and wait for it to become ready volume = self.volumes_client.create_volume( 1, display_name='test')['volume'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_volume, volume['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') new_volume_id = volume['id'] self.servers_client.update_server_volume( self.server['id'], old_volume_id, new_volume_id) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(old_volume_id, 'available') self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(new_volume_id, 'in-use') # Get Volume attachment of the server body = self.servers_client.show_volume_attachment( self.server['id'], new_volume_id) self.assertEqual(new_volume_id, body['volumeAttachment']['volumeId']) # New volume needs to be detached because volume gets # deleted before deleting the server during cleanup self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], new_volume_id)

commit_message:
Add a test for checking a cascade (enable-disable) operation for a project

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
method Enable or disable subtree (PATCH /projects/{project_id}/cascade):
enables or disables the project itself and its whole subtree.

Partially Implements: blueprint project-subtree-tests

Change-Id: I09fa2419775d3f883996cd74e9b67b0167f4fbd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/77/270177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('8908f715-051c-49f6-9683-ea6c719f3049') def test_enable_project_subtree(self): # Create two project, one of them is parent # make parent enable=true and check another one is enabled def api_num(s): """Supposing that version is in this format as v3.4.""" return sum([int(r[1]) * 100 ** (r[0] + 1) for r in enumerate(s[::-1].split('.'))]) # get API version. # The test is available for API version v3.6 and higher. desc = self.client.show_api_description() version = desc['version']['id'][1:] if api_num(version) < api_num('3.6'): return # create project #1 p1_name = data_utils.rand_name('project1') project1 = self.client.create_project(p1_name)['project'] # create project #2 with parent_id = project1_id p2_name = data_utils.rand_name('project2') project1_id = project1['id'] project2 = self.client.create_project( p2_name, parent_id=project1_id)['project'] self.data.projects.append(project2) self.data.projects.append(project1) # setting p1.enabled=False also changes p2.enabled self.client.enable_project_subtree(project1_id, False) p1 = self.client.get_project(project1['id'])['project'] p2 = self.client.get_project(project2['id'])['project'] self.assertEqual(p1['enabled'], False) self.assertEqual(p2['enabled'], False) # setting p1.enabled=True also changes p2.enabled self.client.enable_project_subtree(project1_id, True) p1 = self.client.get_project(project1['id'])['project'] p2 = self.client.get_project(project2['id'])['project'] self.assertEqual(p1['enabled'], True) self.assertEqual(p2['enabled'], True)

commit_message:
fix v6 tests on NetworkManager-based operating systems

IPv6 tests are failing on Network Manager-based Operating Systems.
eth1 interface used in dualnet v6 tests is brought down by NM due to
lack of cloud-init and local ifcfg-* config and no dhcp server avaiable
on network eth1 is attached to. This change adds creating a NM
connection for eth1 with mac-based IPv6 link-local address.

Change-Id: Icd8443590da89eefde5f3e9c3d1632bf12fe90f4

deleted_lines: ssh.exec_command("sudo ip link set %s up" % nic)

commit_message:
Refactored skip flags for live-migration with volumes

Current implementation doesn't allow to check non-block
live-migration for instances with attached volumes. This
patches allows to configure flags, so it's become possible.

Change-Id: I3b6a9afc4b07835031f10375718c02de4d95b877

deleted_lines: @testtools.skipIf(not CONF.compute_feature_enabled. block_migration_for_live_migration, 'Block Live migration not available') @testtools.skipIf(not CONF.compute_feature_enabled. 'Block Live migration not configured for iSCSI')

commit_message:
Add support for cinder api v3 api testing

cinder api version 3 is the latest current version.

Implemented cinder v3 clients.
Added cinder v3 tests for non-admin
Added cinder v3 tests for admin

Not implemented: VolumesMetadataTest

Change-Id: I8da13f8a12a6b7162454793c24a0455ec2128c11

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from tempest.lib.common import rest_client class LimitsClient(rest_client.RestClient): """Volume V3 limits client.""" api_version = "v3" def show_limits(self): """Returns the details of a volume absolute limits.""" url = "limits" resp, body = self.get(url) body = json.loads(body) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('56dc05cc-76e7-4ee5-8cc6-ba0b57da6cce') @testtools.skipUnless( utils.is_extension_enabled('port-security', 'network'), 'port-security-enabled extension not enabled.') def test_create_port_with_port_security_enabled(self): import pdb;pdb.set_trace(); post_body = { "name": data_utils.rand_name('port-'), "network_id": self.network['id'], "port_security_enabled": True} body = self.ports_client.create_port(**post_body) self.addCleanup(self.ports_client.delete_port, body['port']['id']) port = body['port'] port_security = port.get("port_security_enabled") self.assertTrue(port_security) @decorators.idempotent_id('1ffac7a9-3c9e-4a2d-9acd-9db6f6575945') @testtools.skipUnless( utils.is_extension_enabled('port-security', 'network'), 'port-security-enabled extension not enabled.') def test_create_port_with_port_security_disabled(self): post_body = { "name": data_utils.rand_name('port-'), "network_id": self.network['id'], "port_security_enabled": False} body = self.ports_client.create_port(**post_body) self.addCleanup(self.ports_client.delete_port, body['port']['id']) port = body['port'] port_security = port.get("port_security_enabled") self.assertFalse(port_security)

commit_message:
Add cleanup flag and client param to base classes

The cleanup flag allows for tests to explicitly disable
auto-cleanup in case these want to explicitly cleanup themselves.

The client parameters allows to overrule client, e.g. in case of
admin tests.

Focus in this patchset is to networking base and scenario manager.

Change-Id: I39a34e769480f4490740632a63f6b11346875382

commit_message:
Correcting confusing name used in account_generator.py

There is confusion to generate accounts.yaml file.
In help file it is displaying  in positional arguments as below.

positional arguments:
  accounts_file.yaml    Output accounts yaml file

In CLI usage too, displayed as  accounts_file.yaml:
usage: tempest account-generator [-h] [-c /etc/tempest.conf]
               [--os-username <auth-user-name>]
               [--os-password <auth-password>]
               [--os-project-name <auth-project-name>]
               [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>]
               [--os-domain-name <auth-domain-name>]
               [--tag TAG] [-r CONCURRENCY] [--with-admin]
               [-i {2,3}]
               accounts_file.yaml

But in Usage description, it is accounts.yaml:
Create accounts.yaml file for concurrent test runs. One primary user,
one alt user, one swift admin, one stack owner and one admin
(optionally) will be created for each concurrent thread.

So this patch set will correct the confusing name and use accounts.yaml
at every place. Also, it will modify the doc string by adding that the
file can be created with any name. But it is always appropriate to
create with name accounts.yaml

Change-Id: I6b8d95e7d35a5d490cc67afb1855c7e1f7bf4667
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/09/608609/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **Usage:** ``tempest account-generator [-h] [OPTIONS] accounts.yaml````accounts.yaml`` (Required) Provide an output accounts yaml file. Utility can create with any name but appropriate way is to create by a .yaml file in the directory where the command is ran. The appropriate name for the file is *accounts.yaml* and it should be placed in *tempest/etc* directory.[OPTIONS] <accounts.yaml> -h``. metavar='accounts.yaml',
deleted_lines: **Usage:** ``tempest account-generator [-h] [OPTIONS] accounts_file.yaml````accounts_file.yaml`` (Required) Provide an output accounts yaml file. Utility creates a .yaml file in the directory where the command is ran. The appropriate name for the file is *accounts.yaml* and it should be placed in *tempest/etc* directory.[OPTIONS] <accounts_file.yaml> -h``. metavar='accounts_file.yaml',

commit_message:
Removing deprecated warning in account_generatory.py

There is a deprecated warning in account_generatory.py
There is no need of keeping this warning now.

Ic8dcaff920e5cdfb9a9457ff3a3137c225622409 suggested this change.
So this patch set will remove the deprecated Log warning.

Change-Id: I1f3e2fb27b43b88c4987ff4d94ebbdb72ac35018

commit_message:
Use system creds for system operations

Keystone's is_admin_project and in future 'system' credentials are used
to perform operations that do not fall into the traditional project
hierarchy. These are operations such as hypervisor or infrastructure
commands that are independant of projects.

Currently to perform those operations you have to use the 'admin
project' and in future this will be renamed to a system scope.

Change-Id: Ic96ee6005606f4998d829ef651219bafdbaa95fe

commit_message:
Make volume type name luks unique

The name luks is used twice which would make these fail when run in
parallel.

Change-Id: I5107cb99055b19fa13e906087806f5cfd3b04ef5

commit_message:
DNM: PowerVM vSCSI CI enablement

DO NOT MERGE

The PowerVM driver needs the tempest vms to have an active RMC
connection to be able to attach volumes. This patch introduces time
delays before attempting to attach the volumes to instances.

Change-Id: I2fa18f94627b5f94fa675f67551b61226a10faac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/82/568982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time # PowerVM needs to have active RMC status to attach volumes. # The RMC status takes a long time to become active. This will wait # long enough for it to become active. time.sleep(600)

commit_message:
Add devstack base job with minimal services

This commit adds a new devstack base job with minimal services enabled
so it can be used as a base for jobs where the project would like to
explicitly enable every service.

It would act in a similar way as the base: false was used before.

Change-Id: I899accb02843a4151191e4edd8c6cd5105347acd

import fake_http from tempest.tests.lib.services import base from tempest.lib.services.network import agents_client class TestAgentsClient(base.BaseServiceTest): FAKE_AGENTS = { "agents": [ "agent1", "agent2", "agent3" ] } FAKE_NETWORK_ID = 'adfsddhjl7a8sg4bdsafgb' FAKE_AGENTS_ID = '7a8sg4b-c1ed-sdfsg4446-a87d-60440c02934b' FAKE_ROUTER_ID = '7a8sg4bdsafgb' def setUp(self): super(TestAgentsClient, self).setUp() fake_auth = fake_auth_provider.FakeAuthProvider() self.client = agents_client.AgentsClient( fake_auth, 'compute', 'regionOne') def test_update_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.update_agent, 'tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.put', {"fake_agent": self.FAKE_AGENTS["agents"][1]}, bytes_body, 200, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID ) def test_show_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.show_agent, 'tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.get', self.FAKE_AGENTS, bytes_body, 200, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID ) def test_list_agents(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.list_agents, 'tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.get', self.FAKE_AGENTS, bytes_body, 200 ) def test_list_routers_on_l3_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.list_routers_on_l3_agent, "tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.get", self.FAKE_AGENTS, bytes_body, 200, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID ) def test_create_router_on_l3_agent(self, test_delete_router_from_l3_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.delete_router_from_l3_agent, "tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.delete", {}, bytes_body, 204, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID, router_id=self.FAKE_ROUTER_ID ) def test_list_networks_hosted_by_one_dhcp_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.list_networks_hosted_by_one_dhcp_agent, "tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.get", self.FAKE_AGENTS, bytes_body, 200, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID ) def test_delete_network_from_dhcp_agent(self, bytes_body=False): self.check_service_client_function( self.client.delete_network_from_dhcp_agent, "tempest.lib.common.rest_client.RestClient.delete", {}, bytes_body, 204, agent_id=self.FAKE_AGENTS_ID, network_id=self.FAKE_NETWORK_ID ) def test_add_dhcp_agent_to_network(self, bytes_body=True): self.check_service_client_function( commit_message:
Add Resources Configuration class

Adding class that loads resources.yaml file or uses existing
configuration options to build a compatible data structure.

Partially implements blueprint tempest-resources

Change-Id: I1bf5093297b2219636791a15fba07f1ed09362a6

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import yaml from tempest.common import resource_configuration from tempest.tests import base RESOURCES = {'resources': { 'images': [ {'id': 'e033ef95-bf59-4a52-853a-1f45821994b0'}, {'id': '1a37b4a4-ff58-497b-ab2a-115bc06b0769'}], 'flavors': [ {'id': '1'}, {'id': '2'}]}} class TestResourceConfiguration(base.TestCase): def test_no_resources_file(self): resources = resource_configuration.ResourceConfiguration( image_id='e033ef95-bf59-4a52-853a-1f45821994b0', image_id_alt='1a37b4a4-ff58-497b-ab2a-115bc06b0769', flavor_id='1', flavor_id_alt='2').resources self.assertEqual(RESOURCES, resources) @mock.patch('yaml.load') @mock.patch('six.moves.builtins.open', create=True) def test_resources_file(self, mock_open, mock_load): yaml.load.return_value = RESOURCES resources = resource_configuration.ResourceConfiguration( test_resources_file='/opt/stack/tempest/etc/resources.yaml') mock_open.assert_called_once_with( '/opt/stack/tempest/etc/resources.yaml', 'r') mock_load.assert_called_once_with(mock_open.return_value.__enter__()) self.assertEqual(RESOURCES, resources.resources)

subject: Use neutron client for floating ips in scenarios
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-25 23:47:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4ac9ee24a002543bc68b4be7e7b2dcce1dc9ff95', 'message': 'Use neutron client for floating ips in scenarios

os-floating-ips in compute API are deprecated starting with
microversion 2.36.  Several scenarios still use os-floating-ips
implementation in the compute client to create and delete floating ips.

With this change neutron client is used to create and delete floating
ips if neutron service is available.  Otherwise use os-floating-ips
implementation in compute client.

Changes include:
- Moving methods related to creating floating ips using neutron from
  NetworkScenarioTest to its parent ScenarioTest.
- Changed existing method for creating floating ips in ScenarioTest to
  be a wrapper method that uses neutron to create floating ips if
  neutron service is available.  Otherwise use compute client.
- Add wrapper method for deleting floating ips in ScenarioTest.
- Add admin credential to scenarios that create floating ips.  This is
  necessary because creating floating ips with neutron needs admin
  credential to list ports and find the correct port to associate the
  floating ip to.

Change-Id: I995ec1568e1bc5b5ee4963721e2b09c21605df63

commit_message:
Use neutron client for floating ips in scenarios

os-floating-ips in compute API are deprecated starting with
microversion 2.36.  Several scenarios still use os-floating-ips
implementation in the compute client to create and delete floating ips.

With this change neutron client is used to create and delete floating
ips.

Changes include:
- Moving methods related to creating floating ips using neutron from
  NetworkScenarioTest to its parent ScenarioTest.
- Added wait to verify that floating ip has been attached to a server
  when creating floating ip with either network or compute client.
- Removed methods for creating floating ips using compute floating ip
  client.
- Add wrapper method for deleting floating ips in ScenarioTest.
- Add admin credential to scenarios that create floating ips.  This is
  necessary because creating floating ips with neutron needs admin
  credential to list ports and find the correct port to associate the
  floating ip to.

Change-Id: I995ec1568e1bc5b5ee4963721e2b09c21605df63

Add a test for Get Service Catalog

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
the call 'GET /auth/catalog'

Partially Implements: blueprint authentication-specific-routes-tests
Change-Id: I93a37524b16a190892da850f2f2da0b50c3b42bc

commit_message:
Add options to run_tempest.sh to redirect output to a file

This way the results can be easily stored and retrieved.
 -o | --output will redirect to tempest.out
 -O | --output-file will changed the output file location.

.gitignore was also updated to ignire *.out files since the default output-file is tempest.out

Change-Id: I7caa068fad7ad8897aa0ef3cebd4dd8ae3e8ea72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/153318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " -o, --output Write stdout and stderr to file. Default is tempest.out" echo " -O, --output-file Output file location. Default is tempest.out"output=0 output_file=tempest.out if ! options=$(getopt -o VNnfusthdC:lL:oO: -l virtual-env,no-virtual-env,no-site-packages,force,update,smoke,serial,help,debug,config:,logging,logging-config:,output,output-file: -- "$@") -o|--output) output=1;; -O|--output-file) output_file=$2; shift;;if [ $output -eq 1 ]; then exec 1> $output_file 2>&1 fi

added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('aed2203c-8eb2-46b2-bf8e-c5b083513abf') def test_get_available_domain_scopes(self): # Create domain only with name d_name = data_utils.rand_name('domain') domain = self.client.create_domain(d_name)['domain'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_domain, domain['id']) # Create a role role_name = data_utils.rand_name(name='role') role = self.client.create_role(name=role_name)['role'] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_role, role['id']) user_id = self.non_admin_client.user_id self.client.assign_user_role_on_domain(domain['id'], user_id, role['id']) scopes = self.non_admin_client.get_available_domain_scopes() self.assertEqual(d_name, scopes['domains'][0]['name'])

commit_message:
Add a test for 'Delete subtree' Identity API V3 method

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
method 'Delete subtree' (DELETE /projects/{project_id}/cascade)

Partially Implements: blueprint project-subtree-tests

Change-Id: Ic0c6697277207b30a44010584e9a96050f4b6599
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/01/269701/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('cc2c4df8-2baa-41e5-83fb-fef2f1fed099') def test_delete_project_subtree(self): def api_num(s): """Supposing that version is in this format as v3.4.""" return sum([int(r[1]) * 100 ** (r[0] + 1) for r in enumerate(s[::-1].split('.'))]) desc = self.client.show_api_description() version = desc['version']['id'][1:] if api_num(version) < api_num('3.6'): return # create project #1 p_name = data_utils.rand_name('project1') project1 = self.client.create_project(p_name)['project'] # create project #2 with parent_id = project1_id p_name = data_utils.rand_name('project2') project1_id = project1['id'] project2 = self.client.create_project( p_name, parent_id=project1_id)['project'] self.data.projects.append(project2) self.data.projects.append(project1) # delete project #1 self.client.delete_project_subtree(project1_id) # check if project1 and project2 were deleted project_list = self.client.list_projects()['projects'] p_qnty = len([p for p in project_list if p['id'] in (project1['id'], project2['id'])]) self.assertEqual(p_qnty, 0)

e.g. 'tempest run --test-set volume'

commit_message:
Adds the ResourceProvider class

Adds the ResourceProvider class, which builds on the
ResourceConfiguration class by providing filtering logic.

Partially implements blueprint tempest-resources

Change-Id: I768ce5954ac09c68a0634fb241bbbc69e1d7bb19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/286342/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Rackspace Hosting # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from tempest.common import resource_configuration from tempest.common import resource_provider from tempest import exceptions from tempest.tests import base RESOURCES = [ {'resource_name': 'ubuntu', 'uuid': '1', 'size': '1 GB', 'boot': 'slow'}, {'resource_name': 'ubuntu-lts', 'uuid': '2', 'size': '1 GB', 'boot': 'fast'}, {'resource_name': 'debian', 'uuid': '3', 'size': '600 MB', 'boot': 'slow'}, {'resource_name': 'windows', 'uuid': '4', 'size': '9 GB', 'boot': 'slow'} ] RESOURCE_TYPES = ['images', 'flavors'] class TestResourceProvider(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestResourceProvider, self).setUp() resource_config = mock.MagicMock( resource_configuration.ResourceConfiguration) resource_config.get_resources_by_type.return_value = RESOURCES resource_config.get_resource_types.return_value = RESOURCE_TYPES self.provider = resource_provider.ResourceProvider(resource_config) def test_get_resource_no_filter(self): resource = self.provider.get_resources_by_type('images', []) self.assertEqual(resource.get('resource_name'), 'ubuntu') def test_get_resource_with_filter(self): resource = self.provider.get_resources_by_type( 'images', [], boot='fast') self.assertEqual(resource.get('resource_name'), 'ubuntu-lts') def test_get_resource_with_multiple_filters(self): resource = self.provider.get_resources_by_type( 'images', [], boot='slow', size='9 GB') self.assertEqual(resource.get('resource_name'), 'windows') def test_get_resource_with_resources_in_use(self): resource = self.provider.get_resources_by_type( 'images', [RESOURCES[0]]) self.assertEqual(resource.get('resource_name'), 'ubuntu-lts') def test_get_resource_all_resources_used(self): self.assertRaises( exceptions.InvalidConfiguration, self.provider.get_resources_by_type, 'images', RESOURCES) def test_get_resource_with_fallback(self): resource = self.provider.get_resources_by_type( 'images', [], boot='really-fast', fallback_enabled=True) self.assertEqual(resource.get('resource_name'), 'ubuntu') def test_get_resource_with_fallback_no_resource_found(self): self.assertRaises( exceptions.InvalidConfiguration, self.provider.get_resources_by_type, 'images', [], boot='really-fast') def test_get_resource_unexpected_resource_type(self): self.assertRaises( exceptions.InvalidConfiguration, self.provider.get_resources_by_type, 'servers', [])

commit_message:
Update refs to primary creds in base test

This change updates the references to the primary credentials
in the base test case and makes the necessary changes in
inherting classes to ensure that the setup of validation
resources still works correctly.

partially implements blueprint simplify-credentials-management

Change-Id: I06af71edef8e5c0cce8446d2fff5b67ea61a9c0b
