commit_message:
The admin infos are in auth section, correcct in configuration.rst

Change-Id: I0d46e51be1c9a9cb2ba22f77a239f4cf4cd26473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/87/270587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tempest currently has 2 different ways in configuration to provide credentials to use when running tempest. One is a traditional set of configuration options in the tempest.conf file. These options are in the auth and identity sections and let you specify a global admin user, a regular user and an alternate user set of credentials. (which consist of a username, password, and project/tenant name) These options should be clearly labelled in the sample config file in the auth and identity sections.
deleted_lines: Tempest currently has two different ways in configuration to provide credentials to use when running Tempest. One is a traditional set of configuration options in the tempest.conf file. These options are clearly labelled in the ``identity`` section and let you specify a set of credentials for a regular user, a global admin user, and an alternate user, consisting of a username, password, and project/tenant name.

subject: Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 08:31:55.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/ssh.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/ef767969f9daa336c4fac1a9b740eb4c7eb66903', 'message': 'Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: If13301bc2df30d02c0a2e37b3e908c0fa199e6c7
'}]
commit_message:
Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: If13301bc2df30d02c0a2e37b3e908c0fa199e6c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/88/284588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def exec_command(self, cmd, encoding="utf-8", transport=None): :param object transport: Transport to use for connection if not provided new one will be created if not transport: ssh = self._get_ssh_connection() transport = ssh.get_transport() @staticmethod def get_private_key_from_string(private_key_string): file_like = six.StringIO.StringIO(private_key_string) private_key = paramiko.RSAKey.from_private_key(file_obj=file_like) file_like.close() return private_key def exec_command_on_remote_server(self, remote_server_ip, cmd, proxy_username=None, proxy_key=None, remote_username=None, remote_key=None): """Runs command on remote server (nested ssh) Remote server can be only reached from self.host :param str proxy_username: Username on proxy host :param str remote_server_ip: Ip of remote server to run command on :param str cmd: Command to run at remote server. :param str remote_username: Username to connect to proxy host. if not provided - self.username will be used :param str proxy_key: String with private key to connect to proxy host. If not provided self.key_filename will be used :param str remote_username: Remote host user, if not provided self.username will be used :param str remote_key: String with private key to connect to remote server. If not provided self.key_filename will be used. :returns: data read from standard output of the command. """ proxy_username = proxy_username or self.username remote_username = remote_username or self.username proxy_connection = paramiko.Transport((self.host, 22)) proxy_connection.start_client() if proxy_key: private_key = Client.get_private_key_from_string(proxy_key) else: private_key = self.pkey proxy_connection.auth_publickey(proxy_username, private_key) channel = proxy_connection.open_channel('direct-tcpip', (remote_server_ip, 22), ('127.0.0.1', 0)) transport = paramiko.Transport(channel) transport.start_client() if remote_key: remote_private_key = Client.get_private_key_from_string(remote_key) else: remote_private_key = self.pkey transport.auth_publickey(remote_username, remote_private_key) try: command_result = self.exec_command(cmd, transport=transport) finally: transport.close() proxy_connection.close() return command_result
deleted_lines: def exec_command(self, cmd, encoding="utf-8"): ssh = self._get_ssh_connection() transport = ssh.get_transport()

commit_message:
[OSC] Fix the default API_VERSION in unit tests

The API_VERSION in some unit tests for OSC share commands
are set to API microversion 2.51. However, the default value
should be set to MAX_VERSION so the tests would be aligned
with the latest defined microversion.

This patch was submitted during the GHC2021 Summer OSD

Closes-Bug: #1913956
Change-Id: Ibb8c373dbb4620ea8e67d85f641a708162f06d64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/97/800997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manilaclient.api_versions import MAX_VERSION MAX_VERSION self.app.client_manager.share.api_version = api_versions.APIVersion( '2.51')

subject: Use older run-tempest for stable branches
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-21 23:31:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/57da695faf95f596965720b357106c68716825ad', 'message': 'Use older run-tempest for stable branches

run-tempest is changed recently to add the new variables but
keep supporting the old ones too, for example:
tempest_black_regex, tempest_exclude_regex. and if both
old and new var are used in job definition (parent and child) then
new variables are picked. Because Tempest is branchless, zuul pick
the Tempest master playbooks/roles. That is why job running on stable
branch gate will pick the base job definition from Tempest master.
This way if any stable jobs which were defining the old var and using old
Tempest are broken if any of their parent job define the new var.

This commit pin the older run-tempest role for such stable branches.

Change-Id: If49ab0c31aca5b7837636727096a9bc83f891b1b

commit_message:
Use older run-tempest for stable branches

run-tempest is changed recently to add the new variables but
keep supporting the old ones too, for example:
tempest_black_regex, tempest_exclude_regex. and if both
old and new var are used in job definition (parent and child) then
new variables are picked. Because Tempest is branchless, zuul pick
the Tempest master playbooks/roles. That is why job running on stable
branch gate will pick the base job definition from Tempest master.
This way if any stable jobs which were defining the old var and using old
Tempest are broken if any of their parent job define the new var.

This commit pin the older run-tempest role for such stable branches.

Change-Id: If49ab0c31aca5b7837636727096a9bc83f891b1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/55/787455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tasks: - name: Run Tempest version <= 26.0.0 include_role: name: run-tempest-26 when: - zuul.branch is defined - zuul.branch in ["stable/ocata", "stable/pike", "stable/queens", "stable/rocky", "stable/stein"] - name: Run Tempest include_role: name: run-tempest when: - zuul.branch is defined - zuul.branch not in ["stable/ocata", "stable/pike", "stable/queens", "stable/rocky", "stable/stein"]

commit_message:
Handle use-internal-endpoints properly.

The ironic conductor, by default, will use internal endpoints when
communicating with other services such as nova, keystone, etc. The
use-internal-endpoints config option in the charm doesn't update the
configuration for the valid_interfaces that the clients should use
when communicating with other services. This change sets the
internal_endpoints option explicitly to honor the charm setting.

Closes-Bug: #1934907
Change-Id: I235391737858d9f7b3ee1e352bbcb1704c52af32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ironic-conductor refs/changes/09/799909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # By default, the valid_interfaces are set to: internal,public # which causes the internal endpoints to be used first. Be more # explicit to match the charm option {% if options.use_internal_endpoints -%} valid_interfaces = internal {% else -%} valid_interfaces = public,internal {% endif -%}region_name = {{ options.region }}

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from ansible.module_utils.basic import AnsibleModule from yaml import safe_load as yaml_safe_load import json import yaml DOCUMENTATION = ''' --- module: DPDK NIC's NUMA details short_description: Gets the DPDK NIC's NUMA details description: - Gets the DPDK NIC's NUMA details options: dpdk_mapping_file: required: true description: - The DPDK mapping file path type: str author: "Jaganathan Palanisamy" ''' EXAMPLES = ''' - hosts: ComputeOvsDpdk tasks: tasks: - name: Get DPDK NIC's NUMA info become: true get_dpdk_nics_numa_info: dpdk_mapping_file: /var/lib/os-net-config/dpdk_mapping.yaml register: dpdk_nics_numa ''' # Gets the DPDK NIC's mapping with NIC physical name and driver info for the given MAC. def get_dpdk_nics_mapping(module, dpdk_mapping_file, mac): cmd = "sudo cat " + dpdk_mapping_file result = module.run_command(cmd) if (not result or (result[0] != 0) or not (str(result[1]).strip(' '))): err = "Unable to determine DPDK NIC's details" module.fail_json(msg=err) else: dpdk_nics_map = yaml.load(str(result[1])) for dpdk_nic_map in dpdk_nics_map: if dpdk_nic_map['mac_address'] == mac: return dpdk_nic_map else: err = ("Unable to determine DPDK NIC Mapping for MAC: '%(mac)s'" % {'mac':mac}) module.fail_json(msg=err) def get_dpdk_nics_info(module, dpdk_mapping_file): dpdk_nics_info = [] dpdk_nics = [] cmd = "sudo ovs-vsctl --columns=name,type,admin_state --format=json list interface" result = module.run_command(cmd) if (not result or (result[0] != 0) or not (str(result[1]).strip(' '))): err = "Unable to determine DPDK NIC's details" module.fail_json(msg=err) else: nics = json.loads(str(result[1])) for nic in nics.get('data', []): if nic and str(nic[1]) == 'dpdk' and str(nic[2]) == 'up': dpdk_nics.append(str(nic[0])) if dpdk_nics: cmd = "sudo ovs-vsctl --column=mac-in-use,mtu,status --format=json list interface " + ' '.join(dpdk_nics) result = module.run_command(cmd) if (not result or (result[0] != 0) or not (str(result[1]).strip(' '))): err = "Unable to determine DPDK NIC's details" module.fail_json(msg=err) else: nics_info = json.loads(str(result[1])) for nic_info in nics_info.get('data', []): data = {} data['mac'] = nic_info[0] #data['mtu'] = nic_info[1] for field in nic_info[2][1]: if field[0] == 'numa_id': data['numa_node'] = int(field[1]) dpdk_nic_map = get_dpdk_nics_mapping(module, dpdk_mapping_file, nic_info[0]) #data['nic'] = dpdk_nic_map['name'] data['pci'] = dpdk_nic_map['pci_address'] dpdk_nics_info.append(data) return dpdk_nics_info # Gets the DPDK NIC's NUMA info def get_dpdk_nics_numa_info(module, dpdk_mapping_file): result = dict( changed=False, dpdk_nics_numa_info=[], message='' ) dpdk_nics_info = get_dpdk_nics_info(module, dpdk_mapping_file) if not dpdk_nics_info: err = "Unable to determine DPDK NIC's NUMA info" module.fail_json(msg=err) else: result['messsage'] = "DPDK NIC's NUMA info" result['dpdk_nics_numa_info'] = dpdk_nics_info module.exit_json(**result) def main(): module = AnsibleModule( argument_spec=yaml_safe_load(DOCUMENTATION)['options'] ) get_dpdk_nics_numa_info(module, module.params.get('dpdk_mapping_file')) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

added_lines: However, it is import to restore only the OpenStack related databases and not the mysql or performance_schema databases from the Percona Cluster instantiation. Restoring those DBs will corrupt the new MySQL Innodb Cluster leading to LP Bug #1936210. Depending on downtime restrictions it is possible to dump all databases at one time: run the ``mysqldump`` action by setting the ``databases`` parameter to a comma separated list. i.e. ``databases=keystone,cinder,glance,nova,nova_api,nova_cell0,horizon`` Similarly, it is possible to import all the databases into .. warning:: Do not restore the Percona Cluster version of the mysql or performance_schema databases into the MySQL Innodb Cluster. This will corrupt the DB and leads to LP Bug#1936210. This will require the destruction and re-creation of the mysql-innodb-cluster.
